Psychology_tweet_120_r$Psychology_17_r$P.text:
Finding A: Thosewho were sociosexually unrestricted reported lower stress and greater overall emotional health after casual sex \xa0
Finding B: The researchers also made the observation of an increased risk of hyperactivity disorder among circumcised boys in non-Muslim families.
Finding C: Neural mechanisms linking depressive symptoms with sleep disturbances (n = 1,017)
Finding D: "Consumers who knew they had received a targeted ad reported being more interested in the advertised product, and even changed their self-perceptions to be more in line with what the ad implied about them," she explains.

Finding A: Thosewho were sociosexually unrestricted reported lower stress and greater overall emotional health after casual sex \xa0
Finding B: The researchers also made the observation of an increased risk of hyperactivity disorder among circumcised boys in non-Muslim families.
Finding C: Neural mechanisms linking depressive symptoms with sleep disturbances (n = 1,017)
Finding D: "Consumers who knew they had received a targeted ad reported being more interested in the advertised product, and even changed their self-perceptions to be more in line with what the ad implied about them," she explains.

Psychology_tweet_108_p$Psychology_tweet_.text:
Finding A: We conclude that an empirical understanding of the effect of slow motion on mental state attribution should inform the life-or-death decisions that are currently based on tacit assumptions about the objectivity of human perception.
Finding B: \'Upstream Color\' in a neuro tweet? LIP neurons exhibit integrative representations of both color & motion features
Finding C: Coping planning showed an interaction with received social support for continuous abstinence (p< .05, see Table 2 , third column).
Finding D: Importantly, we observe that happiness increases before birth, suggesting that the happiness gain around the time of birth may capture not only the effect of the birth but also the complex childbearing process that may involve partnership formation, partnership quality, and increased sexual activity.

Finding D: Importantly, we observe that happiness increases before birth, suggesting that the happiness gain around the time of birth may capture not only the effect of the birth but also the complex childbearing process that may involve partnership formation, partnership quality, and increased sexual activity.

Psychology_275_r$Psychology_tweet_129_p$.text:
Finding A: For example, in one experiment, people felt more environmentally conscious after they received a behaviorally targeted ad for a "green" product.
Finding B: Most concerning is the potential that the combination of age appropriate sexual motivation and interest, limited sexual knowledge and experiences, and additional social deficits, may place adolescents and young adults with ASD at increased risk for sexual violence victimization.
Finding C: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).
Finding D: Two more experiments indicated that the angle of the eyebrows drove this effect -- downward-tilted heads had eyebrows that appeared to take more of a V shape, even though the eyebrows had not moved from a neutral position, and this was associated with perceptions of dominance.

Finding A: For example, in one experiment, people felt more environmentally conscious after they received a behaviorally targeted ad for a "green" product.
Finding B: Most concerning is the potential that the combination of age appropriate sexual motivation and interest, limited sexual knowledge and experiences, and additional social deficits, may place adolescents and young adults with ASD at increased risk for sexual violence victimization.
Finding C: Results: With a total of 4986 ASD cases, our study showed that regardless of cultural background circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).
Finding D: Two more experiments indicated that the angle of the eyebrows drove this effect -- downward-tilted heads had eyebrows that appeared to take more of a V shape, even though the eyebrows had not moved from a neutral position, and this was associated with perceptions of dominance.
